thread.title: Bikers Ride Inside Tunnel Piece Lying In Middle Of Road In Maharashtra; Hilarious Viral Clip Gets 15M Views
thread.title_full: Bikers Ride Inside Tunnel Piece Lying In Middle Of Road In Maharashtra; Hilarious Viral Clip Gets 15M Views

author: @TIMESNOW
title: Bikers Ride Inside Tunnel Piece Lying In Middle Of Road In Maharashtra; Hilarious Viral Clip Gets 15M Views
text:
Viral
Bikers Ride Inside Tunnel Piece Lying In Middle Of Road In Maharashtra; Hilarious Viral Clip Gets 15M Views
A video showing bikers casually riding through a tunnel segment lying in the middle of a road has amused the internet, sparking a wave of hilarious reactions. The clip, reportedly from Nashik, has garnered over 15 million views and widespread laughter online.
Bikers Ride Inside Tunnel Piece Lying In Middle Of Road In Maharashtra; Hilarious Viral Clip Gets 15M Views (Image Source - @mr_abhiahek0464/Instagram)
In a bizarre video going viral on social media, some people on motorbikes can be seen riding through a tunnel segment lying in the middle of the road, blocking traffic. The unusual sight has left the internet in splits, with many sharing hilarious reactions. Though the exact location remains unconfirmed, some users suggested the video is from Nashik.
The clip was shared on Instagram by a user identified as Abhishek Singh. In it, a piece of a tunnel can be seen lying on the road, obstructing vehicles. As people try to navigate the area, some bikers can be seen riding through the tunnel piece to cross the road. A text overlay on the video reads, “Indian public day by day.” Based on one of the bikers’ number plates, viewers speculated that the incident took place in Maharashtra.
As the video went massively viral — amassing over 5 lakh likes, 3,000 comments, and more than 15 million views — the user later shared another clip urging people not to drive through the tunnel as it could be dangerous. The overlay text read, “Maine ek video dala tha jo viral hui thi. Lekin koi iske andar se bike leke mat jao, accident ho sakta hai.”
The incident sparked hilarious reactions online. One user joked, “I passed from here too… because the road was closed. Don’t judge me—judge the road.”
Another quipped, “Budget tunnel experience.” A third commented, “Visual representation of ‘ek rasta band hota hai to dusra khulta hai.’”
One more added, “Common cliché dialogue — India is not for beginners.''
Surbhi Kaul author
